bulkLayerSelect.noLayersSelected: Select one or more layers to continue

csvFields.fieldDescription: Select the fields that will be included in the hosted feature layer. Optionally, update the display name and field type.
csvFields.fieldNoHostedDescription: Optionally, update the display names and field types to be used in the layer.
csvFields.noFields: No fields found that meet your search criteria. Try changing your search term or expand your filter options.

noTimeStampOffsetForEnterprise.title: ArcGIS Enterprise does not support Timestamp Offset fields in hosted feature layers
noTimeStampOffsetForEnterprise.description: Please change the field type to string or unselect the field to continue.

csvLocationFields.locationSettingsDescription: Specify the type of location information the file contains.
csvLocationFields.enrichLayerDescription: Append fields that provide information about the geocoding process, like how closely the location information in your file matches the locator.
csvLocationFields.enrichLayerLink: Learn more about these appended fields.
csvLocationFields.locationFieldSingle: Location information is in one field.
csvLocationFields.locationFieldMultiple: Location information is in multiple fields.
csvLocationFields.locationFieldsDescription: Specify the fields that contain location information.

address.title: Addresses or place names
address.description: Location data is addresses, place names, postal codes, and countries. May consume credits.
address.descriptionDeveloper: Location data is addresses, place names, postal codes, and countries.

coordinates.title: Latitude and longitude
coordinates.description: Location data is latitude and longitude.

mgrs.title: MGRS coordinates
mgrs.description: Location data is in Military Grid Reference System.

usng.title: USNG coordinates
usng.description: Location data is in United States National Grid.

none.title: None
none.description: This ${type} contains no location data and will be added as a table

GeometryOnly.title: No fields
GeometryOnly.description: Locate addresses, but don’t include any additional fields.

Minimal.title: Some fields
Minimal.description: Append four fields that show how well addresses matched.

AllFields.title: All fields
AllFields.description: Append 50 fields for full location information.

noFieldSelected.title: No location field selected
noFieldSelected.description: Select the field containing location data.

coordinate.title: Select coordinate fields
coordinate.description: Select which field to use for both latitude and longitude.

insufficientCredits.title: Insufficient credits
insufficientCredits.description: You do not have enough credits to perform this action. Contact your administrator for additional credits.

noLocationTypeForAppend.title: Tables must contain location information
noLocationTypeForAppend.description: You cannot add features into a layer that does not contain location information.

unrestrictedOrgCredits.title: Organization credits insufficient - action may not complete
unrestrictedOrgCredits.description: Your organization may not have enough credits to complete this action. If the workflow does not complete, contact your administrator for additional credits.

featureLayerFromScratch.label: Layer name
featureLayerFromScratch.captureGPSDescription: Add fields to layers that support capturing GPS receiver information.
featureLayerFromScratch.enableZDefaultsDescription: Allows modeling point, polyline, and polygon features in 3D.
featureLayerFromScratch.enableMDefaultsDescription: Allows storing a measure or value at each vertex for a geometry.

duplicateTitle.title: Layer names must be unique
duplicateTitle.description: Cannot have layers with the same name

invalidFeatureLayerUrl.description: Specify a URL to a feature layer. The layer must include FeatureServer in the URL.

serviceNotExist.description: Service does not exist or is inaccessible.

featureLayerSelect.alertTitle: No custom data providers have been registered
featureLayerSelect.alertDesc: Contact your organization administrator to register a custom data provider.

template.title: Use a template
template.description: Use the layers and fields from a template.

existing.title: Select an existing feature layer
existing.description: Use the layers and fields from an existing feature layer in your organization.

link.title: Provide an ArcGIS Server layer URL
link.description: Use the layer and fields from an ArcGIS Server feature layer.

custom.title: Use a custom data provider
custom.description: Use a pre-registered custom data provider to create a feature layer.

file.title: Upload a file
file.description: Use the layers, fields, and the data contained in a CSV, Excel, Shapefile or other supported file type.

developerCredentialsSelect.title: Credential Types
developerCredentialsSelect.developerCredentialsDescription: Developer credentials are used to get an access token for custom applications. Access tokens are required to authenticate requests to secure items and services.
developerCredentialsSelect.helpChooseAuth: Not sure what type of credential to create? Go to ${linkStart}Types of authentication${endLink}.
developerCredentialsSelect.missingApiTokenOption: Looking for API key credentials? Contact your system's administrator for access.
developerCredentialsSelect.skipSplashScreen: Skip this screen on future visits
developerCredentialsSelect.errorTitle: A credential type must be selected

appAuthentication.title: App authentication
appAuthentication.description: OAuth 2.0 can be used to authenticate ArcGIS users to access content and location-based services on behalf of the authenticated user. Learn more in the security and authentication guide.
appAuthentication.learnMore: To learn more, go to ${linkStart}app credential authentication${endLink}.

comparisonTable.billing: Usage billed to ArcGIS subscription of signed-in user.
comparisonTable.tokenStorage: Token stored server side or in a standalone console script.
comparisonTable.tokenExpiration: Access tokens valid for 2 weeks and include a refresh token.
comparisonTable.privileges: Privileges chosen when credentials are created.

userAuthentication.title: User Authentication
userAuthentication.description: Not sure what type of developer credentials you need? Answer a few questions and we will guide you through the set up.
userAuthentication.learnMore: To learn more, go to ${linkStart}user credential authentication${endLink}.

comparisonTable.billing: Usage is billed to the organization's ArcGIS subscription.
comparisonTable.tokenStorage: Token stored server side or in a standalone console script.
comparisonTable.privileges: Privileges chosen when credentials are created.

apiKeys.title: API keys
apiKeys.description: An application programming interface key (API key) is a permanent access token that defines the scope and permission for granting applications access to ArcGIS location services and private content items for data services.
apiKeys.learnMore: To learn more, go to ${linkStart}API keys${endLink}.

comparisonTable.billing: Usage is billed to the organization's ArcGIS subscription.
comparisonTable.tokenExpiration: Access tokens valid for one year and can be rotated.
comparisonTable.privileges: Privileges chosen when the API key is created.

apiKey.title: API key
apiKey.description: An application programming interface key (API key) is a permanent access token that defines the scope and permission for granting applications access to ArcGIS location services and private content items for data services.

oauth.title: OAuth credentials
oauth.description: OAuth 2.0 can be used to authenticate ArcGIS users to access content and location-based services on behalf of the authenticated user. Learn more in the security and authentication guide.

helpChoose.title: Help me choose
helpChoose.description: Not sure what type of developer credentials you need? Answer a few questions and we will guide you through the set up.

developerCredentialsInput.redirectUrlsDescription: Add allowed URLs to a web page or server endpoint to redirect users to after completing authentication.
developerCredentialsInput.referrerUrlsDescription: Allow access from specific HTTP/HTTPS domains using the HTTP referrer header. You can use * as a wildcard for a subdomain. E.g. https://*.your-app.com. See ${startLink}Security and authentication${endLink} for more details.
developerCredentialsInput.oauth2Hint: You can use OAuth 2.0 to authenticate ArcGIS users to access content and location services on behalf of the authenticated user. Learn more in ${apiLinkStart}Security and authentication${endLink}.
developerCredentialsInput.oauth2HintNoLink: You can use OAuth 2.0 to authenticate ArcGIS users to access content and location services on behalf of the authenticated user.
developerCredentialsInput.applicationEnvDescription: The application environment will affect when the item appears in filtered search results.
developerCredentialsInput.setExpirationDateDescription: Set expiration date for the first API key up to one year in the future.

redirectEmpty.title: Redirect URLs cannot be empty
redirectEmpty.description: Add at least one redirect URL.

referrerEmpty.title: Referrer URLs cannot be empty
referrerEmpty.description: Add at least one referrer URL.

referrerHasInvalidWildcard.title: Invalid character(s) in referrer URL
referrerHasInvalidWildcard.description: Wildcard characters can only be used for an entire subdomain.

registerError.title: Error registering app
registerError.description: Unable to create registered app for item.

invalidCharactersInRedirect.title: Invalid character(s) in redirect URL
invalidCharactersInRedirect.description: The following characters cannot be used: ${invalid}

invalidDate.title: Expiration date cannot exceed a year from today

developerCredentialsPrivilegePicker.privilegesDescription: Grant privileges to allow your access token to perform specific operations.
developerCredentialsPrivilegePicker.credentialsTypeNotice: Applies to app and API key authentication only.
developerCredentialsPrivilegePicker.howCredentialsUsedTitle: How will these credentials be used?
developerCredentialsPrivilegePicker.howCredentialsUsedDescription: Before setting privileges select which type of credentials you are creating.

options.sharedAppCredentials: Create credentials for an app shared with others
options.automationScriptCredentials: Create credentials for a script that runs on your behalf (automation)

developerCredentialsItemAccess.openBrowserItemAccessDescription: Select up to 100 items to grant access to. You may only grant access to items you own.
developerCredentialsItemAccess.openBrowserGlobalItemAccessDescription: Select up to 100 items to grant access to. You may only grant access to items you own. If you update item access, item privileges from the previous step will be overridden.
developerCredentialsItemAccess.closedBrowserItemAccessDescription: Grant access to view specific items and edit specific feature layers that you own.
developerCredentialsItemAccess.closedBrowserGlobalItemAccessDescription: You have selected privileges which grant access to ${startStrong}all items for which you have permissions${endStrong} (owned, shared with you, and public). ${startStrong}We strongly recommend that you restrict access to only the items this token will be used to access or modify.${endStrong} Doing so will override item related privileges set in the previous step.

You have selected privileges which grant access to ${startStrong}all items for which you have permissions. We strongly recommend that you restrict access to only the items this token will be used to access or modify.${endStrong} Doing so will override item related privileges set in the previous step.
developerCredentialsItemAccess.privilegeRemovalNotice: Taking this action will remove the following privileges set in the previous step.

closedBrowserDescription.general: Grant access to view specific items and edit specific feature layers that you own.
closedBrowserDescription.global: You have selected privileges which grant access to ${startStrong}all items for which you have permissions${endStrong} (owned, shared with you, and public). ${startStrong}It is strongly recommended that you restrict access to only the items this token will be used to access or modify.${endStrong} Doing so will override item related privileges set in the previous step.
closedBrowserDescription.globalWithLocationPlatform: You have selected privileges which grant access to ${startStrong}all items for which you have permissions. It is strongly recommended that you restrict access to only the items this token will be used to access or modify.${endStrong} Doing so will override item related privileges set in the previous step.
closedBrowserDescription.itemPrivilegesEnabled: You have selected privileges that grant access to ${startStrong}all items you have permissions for${endStrong}. It is strongly recommended that you restrict item access to only the specific items required by these developer credentials.

openBrowserDescription.general: Grant access to view specific items and edit specific feature layers that you own. Select up to 100 items.
openBrowserDescription.global: Grant access to view specific items and edit specific feature layers that you own. Select up to 100 items. If you update item access, item privileges from the previous step will be overridden.
openBrowserDescription.itemPrivilegesEnabled: You have selected privileges which grant access to ${startStrong}all items for which you have permissions. It is strongly recommended that you restrict access to view the specific items and edit the specific feature layers${endStrong} accessed by these credentials. You can select up to 100 items you own to override item-related privileges set in the previous step.

errors.emptyPrivilegesError: Select privileges, item access, or both to create API key credentials.
errors.itemLimitWarningDescription: Edit your selected items to follow the selected item limit of 100 items.
errors.noAppPrivilegesDescription: Please set app privileges on the previous page in order to register an application.

developerCredentialsSummary.title: Title
developerCredentialsSummary.privilegeDependencyNoticeSingular: Personal privileges grant enhanced capabilities to access tokens and can pose a potential security risk. Learn more in ${startLink}Security and authentication${endLink}.
developerCredentialsSummary.privilegeDependencyNoticePlural: These privileges grant wider access. Please review before including these in the API key.
developerCredentialsSummary.appPrivilegesSummary: This app has been granted (${generalPrivilegesLength}) general privileges and (${adminPrivilegesLength}) admin privileges.
developerCredentialsSummary.itemPrivilegesSummary: Generated API key will have access to (${selectedItemPrivilegesLength}) items.
developerCredentialsSummary.acknowledgePrivileges: I understand and acknowledge the capabilities of the selected privileges.
developerCredentialsSummary.errorDescription: There was an error while registering this item.

developerCredentialsGenerateTokenCheck.readyToGenerateAPIKey: You are ready to generate an API key. You may generate the API key now or at a later time from the item page.
developerCredentialsGenerateTokenCheck.readyToGenerateAPIKeyNotice: Once you generate an API key, you must copy it immediately. Its value is only displayed once.

options.generateAPIKeyOption: Generate the API key now. I am ready to copy and save the key.
options.goToItemDetailsOption: Go to item details page. I'll generate the API key later.

developerCredentialsAutomateChoice.howCredentialsUsedTitle: How will these credentials be used?
developerCredentialsAutomateChoice.howCredentialsUsedDescription: Before setting privileges select which type of credentials you are creating.
developerCredentialsAutomateChoice.sharedAppWarningTitle: When you use this option, you may use configuration options that provide access to items shared publicly and privileges associated with your user account.
developerCredentialsAutomateChoice.automationWarningTitle: When you use this option, you may configure a script that has private item access and advanced privileges that enable it to run on your behalf. Generated tokens and API keys may also include information about your member account.

warningDescriptions.anonymousAccessDescription: Allowing anonymous access to private content via an API key generated in ArcGIS Online is prohibited according to ${startLink}license agreements${endLink} that you have accepted.
warningDescriptions.guardWarningDescription: For security purposes, you should guard the API key created with these credentials as you would guard your username/password.
warningDescriptions.reviewAgreementDescription: For more details please review ${startLink}Master Agreement for Products and Services${endLink}.
warningDescriptions.privateContentDescription: Access to private content is prohibited according to ${startLink}license agreements${endLink} that you have accepted.

options.sharedAppCredentials: Create credentials for an app shared with others
options.automationScriptCredentials: Create credentials for a script that runs on your behalf (automation)

serviceScope.title: Location services
serviceScope.description: Set scopes to grant access to specific ArcGIS location services. Learn more in Security and authentication.

geocodingStored.heading: Geocoding (stored)
geocodingStored.description: Access the geocoding service to perform forward and reverse geocodes including support for suggestions and place searching. You may store the results.

geocodingNotStored.heading: Geocoding (not stored)
geocodingNotStored.description: Access the geocoding service to perform forward and reverse geocodes including support for suggestions and place searching. You may not store the results.

optimizedRouting.heading: Optimized routing
optimizedRouting.description: Access the Routing service to find the best sequence in which to visit the locations.

closestFacility.heading: Closest facility
closestFacility.description: Access the Closest Facility service to find one or more facilities that are closest to an incident based on travel time or travel distance.

locationAllocation.heading: Location allocation
locationAllocation.description: Access the Location Allocation service to choose which facilities from a set of facilities to operate based on their potential interaction with demand points.

multiVehicleRouting.heading: Multi-vehicle routing
multiVehicleRouting.description: Access the Vehicle Routing Problem service to determine what stops should be serviced by each route and in what sequence the stops should be visited.

costMatrix.heading: Origin/destination cost matrix
costMatrix.description: Access the OD Matrix service to create an origin-destination (OD) cost matrix from multiple origins to multiple destinations.

geoEnrichment.heading: GeoEnrichment
geoEnrichment.description: Access the GeoEnrichment service to obtain attributes, reports, and data-driven Infographics which describe demographic, business, and other location-based characteristics for study areas and locations.

routing.heading: Routing
routing.description: Access the Routing service to find the best way to get from one location to another or to visit several locations.

serviceArea.heading: Service area
serviceArea.description: Access the Service Area service to generate an area that represents the distance that can be reached when traveling in a street network.

locatorSelect.heading: Select an option to create a locator

locator.title: Create a locator from a geocode service
locator.description: Specify the URL to an existing ArcGIS Server geocode service.

locator-view.title: Create a locator view from the ArcGIS Geocoding service
locator-view.description: Configure your view to match specific types of locations within specific countries or areas.

url.heading: URL
url.description: Specify a URL to a geocode service

tileLayerSelect.layerTypeHeading: Which type of tile layer do you want to create?

vector.title: Vector tile layer
vector.description: Fast map visualization using a collection of pre-drawn vector tiles which adapt to the resolution of the display device and can be restyled for multiple uses.

raster.title: Raster tile layer
raster.description: Fast map visualization using a collection of pre-drawn map images or tiles.

3dTiles.tilesetTypeHeading: What layer type represents the dataset?
3dTiles.tilesetDescription: The data source does not include information about the 3D layer type. Choose a 3D layer type that best represents your data.

tileLayerSelect.sourceHeading: Select a method to create a tile layer

existing.title: Browse for an existing feature layer
existing.description: Select a hosted feature layer in your content as the source for the fast drawing tile layer.

upload.title: Upload a tile package
upload.titleRaster: Upload a tile package or service definition
upload.description: Upload a package from your local device.
upload.rasterDescription: Upload a package or service definition file from your local device.

store.title: Select a dataset in a data store
store.description: Browse for tile content located in a registered data store.

tileLayerFromUrl.title: Title
tileLayerFromUrl.subDomainPlaceholder: For example: a, b, c, or tile1, tile2, tile3
tileLayerFromUrl.setTileExtent: Set tile extent to the current extent of the map
tileLayerFromUrl.setTileExtentTooltip: The URL can also contain a placeholder for the subdomains where the map tiles are stored.

tileLayerAlreadyExist.title: Unable to create tile layer
tileLayerAlreadyExist.description: A tile layer already exists for the selected feature layer. Select a different one.

badRenderer.title: Unable to create tile layer
badRenderer.description: The selected feature layer has a drawing style that can't be drawn as tiles. Select a different one.

noLayerSelected.title: No layer selected
noLayerSelected.description: Select a feature layer to continue.

sceneLayerFromTemplate.heading: Description
sceneLayerFromTemplate.description: Create an empty 3D object layer that contains system fields and additional fields listed below. The layer is stored in the WGS 1984 coordinate system. You can add features to this layer after you created it.

sceneLayerCreate.heading: Select an option to create a ${layerType} layer.

define.title: Define your own layer
define.description: Specify an empty layer that you can edit and search.

store.title: Select a dataset in a data store
store.description: Browse for ${layerType} layer content in a file or cloud data store registered to ArcGIS Enterprise.

upload.title: Upload data
upload.description: Upload a package or zipped data source from your local drive.

sceneLayerSelect.heading: Select the layer type to host, manage and visualize georeferenced 3D data.

object3d.title: 3D object layer
object3d.description: Each 3D model is represented as a single feature. You can work with formats such as glTF, OBJ, OpenUSD, IFC, Collada or FBX.

building.title: Building layer
building.description: Each BIM model is represented in a hierachical structure organizing many features.

mesh.title: Mesh layer
mesh.description: A continuous meshed surface generated from lidar or photogrammetry.

point.title: 3D point layer
point.description: Point features with labels, marker symbols, or 3D symbols optimized for fast visualization in 3D scenes.

pointCloud.title: Point cloud layer
pointCloud.description: A dense collection of spatial points captured from lidar or photogrammetry.

gaussian.title: Gaussian splat layer
gaussian.description: A photorealistic representation generated from photogrammetry.

voxel.title: Voxel layer
voxel.description: A volumetric representation of spatial data organized into regular 3D grids.

tileLayerTypeSelect.heading: Which type of tile layer do you want to create?

vectorTiles.title: Vector tile layer
vectorTiles.description: Fast map visualization using a collection of pre-drawn vector tiles which adapt to the resolution of their display device and can be restyled for multiple uses.

tiles.title: Raster tile layer
tiles.description: Fast map visualization using a collection of pre-drawn map images or tiles.

tileLayerSettings.title: Review and apply options to tile layer.
tileLayerSettings.visibilityRangeDescription: This range will impact how you visualize your tiles on a map. This can be updated.

autoCreateOption.title: Create tiles automatically
autoCreateOption.description: Tiles will be created on demand as needed and stored for later use.

onlineBasemapOption.title: ArcGIS Online basemaps
onlineBasemapOption.description: Use ArcGIS Online basemaps tiling scheme. Allows your layer to display with ArcGIS Online basemaps.

customBasemap.title: Custom
customBasemap.description: Use the same tiling scheme as an existing tile layer or map image layer. Allows your layer to display with the selected layer.

error.mapServiceError: The request to retrieve the tiling scheme was unable to be completed. Ensure the ArcGIS tile layer is active and responding to requests.
error.noTilingSchemeFound: The ArcGIS tile layer does not have a tiling scheme defined.
error.noMatchSpatialRef: The spatial reference of the tiling scheme must match the feature layer spatial reference.
error.noFileSelected: You must provide a tiling scheme file.

listing.heading: Unable to list content of the data store
listing.description: An error occurred while listing the data store's contents.

dataStoreSelect.description: Leverage agile frameworks to provide a robust synopsis

noDataStoreSelected.description: You must select at least one data store

itemProperties.errorDescription: There was an error while adding this item.

alreadyExists.title: Existing file
alreadyExists.description: A file named "${fileName}" already exists in this folder. Change the folder or rename the file and try again.
alreadyExists.descriptionUnknownFile: An item with this filename already exists in this folder. Change the folder or rename the file and try again.

proPresentationOrg.title: Error
proPresentationOrg.description: This file type can only be added by organization members.

arcgisServerUpload.title: Unable to publish item
arcgisServerUpload.description: This service definition file was created for an ArcGIS Server site and must be uploaded to ArcGIS Server.

invalidShapefile.title: Invalid shapefile
invalidShapefile.description: The uploaded file does not contain a shapefile.

invalidGeodatabase.title: Invalid Geodatabase
invalidGeodatabase.description: The uploaded file does not contain a file geodatabase.

invalid3DObjectFeatureClass.title: Invalid feature class
invalid3DObjectFeatureClass.description: The uploaded file does not contain a file geodatabase with a 3D object feature class.

exceedsFileSize.title: File size exceeded
exceedsFileSize.description: File exceeds the max size allowed of "${size}".

serviceNameExists.title: Service name not available
serviceNameExists.description: A published service with this name already exists within the organization. Service names must be unique across the organization. Use a different name.

serviceNameExistsRecycle.title: Service name not available
serviceNameExistsRecycle.description: A published service with this name already exists within the organization's recycle bin. Service names must be unique across the organization. Use a different name.

invalidGeoJSON.title: Invalid GeoJSON
invalidGeoJSON.description: The JSON file you are uploading is not valid GeoJSON (missing 'type').

invalidJSON.title: Invalid JSON
invalidJSON.description: The JSON file you are uploading is not valid JSON.

failDatastorePublish.title: Unable to publish from data store
failDatastorePublish.description: Failed to publish ${type}, see server logs for more details.

invalidSpatialRef.title: Invalid spatial reference
invalidSpatialRef.description: This service has an incompatible spatial reference

backendReadonlyMode.title: Error
backendReadonlyMode.description: Unable to add items while in read-only mode.

itemProperties.errorPublishing: There was an error publishing this service.
itemProperties.howWillAddService: How will the service be added?
itemProperties.howWillAddDescription: This file will be used to create a ${type} item.
itemProperties.howWillAddSecuredServiceDescription: This service will be used to create an ArcGIS item proxy, which forwards user requests with an appended token.
itemProperties.howWillAddHostedDescription: This file will be used to create a hosted feature layer or table.
itemProperties.azuredatalakegen2store: Microsoft Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2

onboard.title: Tips for adding content
onboard.addDocumentTitle: Add documents, images, and other files
onboard.addDocumentContent: Drag and drop a PDF file, image, Office document and more.
onboard.publishLayerTitle: Publish layers from shapefiles, CSVs and spreadsheets
onboard.publishLayerContent: Turn files on your device or cloud drives into layers you can add to maps.
onboard.publishLayerEnterprise: Turn files into layers that you can add to your maps
onboard.linkLayerTitle: Link to layers on the web
onboard.linkLayerContent: Create layers from URLs that reference ArcGIS Server, OGC services, and KML.

itemTypeInfo.howToAdd: How would you like to add this file?
itemTypeInfo.nonHostedDescription: Add ${type} without publishing. File can be shared and downloaded by others or published at a later date.
itemTypeInfo.nonHostedSceneLayerZipDescription: Add a ${type} without publishing. File can be shared and downloaded by others or published at a later date.
itemTypeInfo.nonHostedSceneLayerDescription: Add your package without publishing. File can be shared and downloaded by others or published at a later date.

error.title: Error while analyzing file
error.description: There was an error trying to analyze your file. Check your file is formatted correctly.

alreadyExists.title: Existing file
alreadyExists.desciption: A file named "${fileName}" already exists in this folder. Rename the file and try again.

duplicateFields.title: Duplicate field names
duplicateFields.description: Duplicate field names are not allowed.

error.emptyFile: The uploaded file contains no data.

missingGeocoder.title: Locator unavailable
missingGeocoder.descriptionn: The default locator is not available. Contact your administrator to review your organization's Geocoding setting.

publishSelect.largeGeoJsonDescription: This GeoJSON contains a large amount of data, consider publishing it as a hosted feature layer for best results.
publishSelect.largeGeoJsonConditionDescription: If this GeoJSON contains a large amount of data, for best results create a hosted feature layer instead.
publishSelect.bigGeoJsonHint: For best performance, this data can only be added to the map as a hosted feature layer.
publishSelect.bigGeoJsonHintNoPrivilege: This data is too large to be added to the map. It should instead be published as a hosted feature layer.
publishSelect.bigGeoJsonHintPublicAccount: This data is too large to be added to the map. It should instead be published as a hosted feature layer. Upgrade to an ArcGIS Online subscription to publish larger data as hosted layers.

hosted.title: Add data and create a hosted feature layer
hosted.description: Publish the GeoJSON file as a hosted feature layer

nonHosted.title: Add data only
nonHosted.description: Import the GeoJSON file without publishing. The file can be shared or downloaded by others or published at a later date.

3dTiles.tileLayerPublishMessage: The required data store is not configured with this Enterprise portal. The package will be added but no layer will be published.
3dTiles.learnMore: Learn more about required data stores.

hostedTitle.CSV: Add ${fileName} and create a hosted feature layer or table
hostedTitle.CSVNoTable: Add ${fileName} and create a hosted feature layer
hostedTitle.GeoPackage: Add ${fileName} and create a hosted feature layer
hostedTitle.GeoJson: Add ${fileName} and create a hosted feature layer
hostedTitle.JSON: Add ${fileName} and create a hosted feature layer
hostedTitle.Tile Package: Add ${fileName} and create a hosted layer
hostedTitle.Vector Tile Package: Add ${fileName} and create a hosted tile layer
hostedTitle.Service Definition: Add ${fileName} and create a hosted layer
hostedTitle.Scene Package: Add ${fileName} and create a hosted ${layerType} layer
hostedTitle.Image Collection: Add ${fileName} and create a hosted imagery layer
hostedTitle.Desktop Application Template: Add ${fileName} and create a hosted feature layer
hostedTitle.Microsoft Excel: Add ${fileName} and create a hosted feature layer or table
hostedTitle.Google Sheets: Add ${fileName} and create a hosted feature layer or table
hostedTitle.3DTiles Package: Add ${fileName} and create a hosted ${layerType} layer

hostedDescription.CSV: A CSV file with location information is the data source for a hosted feature layer that displays points on a map. A CSV file without location information displays a table that can be viewed, charted, and joined with other layers.
hostedDescription.GeoPackage: A GeoPackage with location information is the source for a hosted layer that displays as points on a map. A GeoPackage without location information displays as a table that can be viewed, charted, and joined with other layers.
hostedDescription.GeoJson: Publish your GeoJSON file as a hosted feature layer. Features are published in the WGS 1984 Web Mercator coordinate system.
hostedDescription.JSON: Publish your JSON file as a hosted feature layer. Features are published in the WGS 1984 Web Mercator coordinate system.
hostedDescription.tile package: Publish your raster tile package as a hosted layer.
hostedDescription.vector tile package: Publish your vector tile package as a hosted tile layer.
hostedDescription.Service Definition: Publish your service definition file as a hosted layer. The published layer type depends on the contents of your SD file.
hostedDescription.serviceDefinitionPublish: Publish your service definition file. The published layer type depends on the contents of your SD file.
hostedDescription.Scene Package: Publish your package as a hosted ${layerType} layer.
hostedDescription.Image Collection: Publish your image collection ZIP file as a hosted imagery layer.
hostedDescription.Desktop Application Template: Publish your desktop application template (ZIP) as a hosted feature layer. A desktop application template that contains location information is the data source for a hosted feature layer that displays points on a map. A desktop application template without location information displays a table that can be viewed, charted, and joined with other layers.
hostedDescription.Microsoft Excel: Publish a hosted feature layer based on your spreadsheet. Spreadsheets without location information will display as a table that can be viewed, charted, and joined with other layers.
hostedDescription.Google Sheets: Publish a hosted feature layer based on your spreadsheet. Spreadsheets without location information will display as a table that can be viewed, charted, and joined with other layers.
hostedDescription.3DTiles Package: Publish your package as a hosted ${layerType} layer.

publishSelect.addDirectlyTitle: Upload the file as an item and add it to the map
publishSelect.addDirectlyUrlTitle: Reference the file from the URL and add it to the map
publishSelect.addDirectlyDescription: Add data without creating a hosted feature layer. Ideal for smaller, externally managed datasets that don’t require features like editing.
publishSelect.addDirectlyUrlDescription: Add data without creating a hosted feature layer. Ideal for smaller datasets that don’t require features like editing. The data is loaded every time the map is opened.
publishSelect.hostedMVTitle: Create a hosted feature layer and add it to the map
publishSelect.hostedMVDescription: Utilize all of the capabilities a feature layer provides, including editing. Manage data completely within ArcGIS Online.
publishSelect.hostedMVDescriptionEnterprise: Utilize all of the capabilities a feature layer provides, including editing. Manage data completely within your organization.
publishSelect.learnMoreAboutServiceDefinition: Learn more about service definition files

hosted.heading: Add ${fileName} and create a hosted feature layer
hosted.description: Add the ${type} and publish as a hosted feature layer that can be added to a map.

sceneLayerHosted.heading: Add ${fileName} and create a hosted ${layerType} layer with associated feature layer
sceneLayerHosted.description: Add a ${type} and publish as a hosted ${layerType} layer with associated feature layer that can be added to a scene.

Shapefile.title: Shapefile
Shapefile.description: A vector data storage format for storing the location, shape, and attributes of geographic features. A shapefile is stored in a set of related files and contains one feature class.

File Geodatabase.title: File geodatabase
File Geodatabase.description: A collection of files in a folder used for storing, querying, and managing both spatial and nonspatial data.

Desktop Application Template.title: Desktop application template
Desktop Application Template.description: Files, data, and application code to deploy on the desktop for use with ArcGIS.

Map Template.title: Map template
Map Template.description: A map template is a map document (.mxd) from which new documents can be created in ArcMap.

Geoprocessing Sample.title: Geoprocessing sample
Geoprocessing Sample.description: A collection of toolboxes, scripts, models, data, and supplemental files used to run geoprocessing tools in ArcGIS.

Code Sample.title: Code sample
Code Sample.description: Shareable code sample in a variety of languages, for example, Java or C++.

ArcPad Package.title: ArcPad package
ArcPad Package.description: ArcPad package files generated via ArcPad Data Manager.

CAD Drawing.title: CAD drawing
CAD Drawing.description: Computer-aided design files generated by the AutoCAD or MicroStation platforms.

CSV Collection.title: CSV collection
CSV Collection.description: CSV collection is a .zip file containing one CSV file per layer.

KML Collection.title: KML collection
KML Collection.description: KML collection is a .zip file containing one KML file per layer.

AppBuilder Widget Package.title: AppBuilder widget package
AppBuilder Widget Package.description: Custom widget or theme extending the capabilities of ArcGIS Web AppBuilder

Photos with Locations.title: Photos with locations
Photos with Locations.description: ZIP file that contains photos with location information (geotagged photos with EXIF location information)

Image Collection.title: Image collection
Image Collection.description: A collection of raster datasets that can be downloaded.

Deep Learning Package.title: Deep learning package
Deep Learning Package.description: Files and data required to run deep learning inferencing tools, used as the input to deep learning raster analysis tools.

GML.title: GML
GML.description: GML (Geography Markup Language) is the XML standard of the OGC to represent information of spatial elements

Application.title: Application
Application.description: An app for desktops built on a desktop platform, such as Java or .NET (Microsoft Windows Desktop).

singleLayerSelect.matrixNotSelected: Select a tile matrix for the service.
singleLayerSelect.selectGeometryError: Select a feature type to display.
singleLayerSelect.usePro: This data set has more than 1000 layers. Enter a search term to find a specific layer.
singleLayerSelect.noLayersFound: No layers found that meet your criteria. Try changing your search term to show more layers.
singleLayerSelect.tooltip: Coverage type is not supported in ArcGIS.

Application.title: Application
Application.description: Add a URL reference to an existing application to share your work with members of your organization and the general public.

AGS.title: ArcGIS Server web service
AGS.description: An ArcGIS Server web service represents a GIS resource—such as a map or image—that is located on an ArcGIS Server site and is made available to client apps such as Map Viewer.

Document Link.title: Document
Document Link.description: Create a link to an online document referenced with a URL.

GeoJson.title: GeoJSON
GeoJson.description: An open standard geospatial data interchange format that represents simple geographic features.

Tile Layer.title: Tile layer
Tile Layer.description: A set of map image tiles, where the formatted URL provides the level, column and row placeholders and optional subdomain: https://domain.com/<path>/{z}{x}{y}.png and https://{subDomain}.domain.com/<path>/{level}/{col}/{row}.png.

KML.title: KML (OGC)
KML.description: KML is an XML-based file format used to represent geographic features in applications such as ArcGIS Earth and Google Earth.

OGCFeatureServer.title: OGC feature layer
OGCFeatureServer.description: An OGC feature layer is a feature service that follows the OGC API – Features specification.

WCS.title: WCS (OGC)
WCS.description: OGC Web Coverage Service (WCS) is a dynamic coverage service that follows the specifications of OGC.

WFS.title: WFS (OGC)
WFS.description: OGC Web Feature Service (WFS) is a dynamic feature service that follows the specifications of OGC.

WMS.title: WMS (OGC)
WMS.description: OGC Web Map Service (WMS) is a dynamic map service that follows the specifications of OGC.

WMTS.title: WMTS (OGC)
WMTS.description: OGC Web Map Tile Service (WMTS) is a set of cached image tiles that follows the specifications of OGC.

GeoRSS.title: GeoRSS
GeoRSS.description: A live web feed that includes geographic features and locations.

urlType.label: Type
urlType.storeAuth: Store credentials with service item. Do not prompt for authentication.
urlType.storeAuthMV: Store credentials with the layer. Do not prompt for authentication.
urlType.serviceNotExist: Service does not exist or is inaccessible.
urlType.unknownAGSType: This service type is not supported.
urlType.serviceNotGIS: Entered URL does not point to a GIS Service.
urlType.unsupportedWFSVersion: This version of WFS is not supported.
urlType.unsupportedWFSGeoJSONOutputFormat: WFS service doesn't support GeoJSON output format.
urlType.unsupportedUrlType: Support for adding this item type is not available.
urlType.flowAborted: Error connecting to service. This service is secured and requires authentication.
urlType.invalidSpatialRef: This service has an incompatible spatial reference
urlType.invalidTileLayerUrl: The URL must provide the level, column, and row placeholders.

timezones.830: (UTC-04:00) Georgetown, La Paz, Manaus, San Juan
timezones.1340: (UTC+01:00) Amsterdam, Berlin, Bern, Rome, Stockholm, Vienna
timezones.1420: (UTC+02:00) Helsinki, Kyiv, Riga, Sofia, Tallinn, Vilnius

timezoneDropdown.title: Time zone
timezoneDropdown.subTitle: Select the time zone your data is in.

hybridImageSelect.heading: Which layer type would you like to add?

ImageServer.title: Dynamic imagery layer
ImageServer.description: Add as a dynamic imagery layer, which supports on-demand server-side processing and rendering.

TiledImageServer.title: Tiled imagery layer
TiledImageServer.description: Add as a tiled imagery layer, which supports client-side projection and rendering from static tiles.

createLayersList.developerCredentialsDescription: Create API key and OAuth 2.0 credentials to build custom applications.
createLayersList.developerCredentialsNoAPIDescription: Create OAuth 2.0 credentials to build custom applications.
createLayersList.featureLayerDescription: Create an editable layer with fields copied from a template or feature layer.
createLayersList.tileLayerDescription: Create a fast drawing vector tile layer or raster tile layer.
createLayersList.sceneLayerDescription: Create a fast drawing layer optimized for 3D.
createLayersList.imageLayerDescription: Create an imagery layer using images from your computer.
createLayersList.locatorDescription: Find places and addresses using the ArcGIS Geocoding service or your own geocode service.
createLayersList.locatorOnlyDescription: Find places and addresses using your own geocode service.
createLayersList.urbanModelDescription: Create a model for urban development with interactive planning and design tools.
createLayersList.urbanModelPermissionError: You must have the privilege to publish a hosted feature layer in order to create an urban model. Contact your ArcGIS Online Administrator for assistance.
createLayersList.applicationDescription: Link to an application on the web or create a new application.
createLayersList.urlDescription: Link to an ArcGIS Server web service, CSV, OGC web service, KML, GeoJSON or a document.
createLayersList.urlDescriptionEnterprise: Link to an ArcGIS Server web service, CSV, OGC web service, KML, GeoJSON or a document.
createLayersList.dataStoreConnectionDescription: Add a connection to a data store you own.
createLayersList.dataStoreDescription: Add a connection to a data store you manage
createLayersList.rasterFunctionTemplateDescription: Create a raster function template that can be used with imagery layers and in raster analysis.
createLayersList.dataPipelineDescription: Integrate external data, perform data preparation operations, and write prepared data to a feature layer.
createLayersList.layer3DBannerTitle: Create a fast drawing layer optimized for 3D
createLayersList.layer3DBannerDescription: With the 3D layer option, you can create scene layer, 3D tiles, and other types of 3D layers.

featureLayerUpload.learnMore: Learn more about the supported file types

url.linkExisting: Link to existing layers or data on the web
url.httpWarning: Use of HTTP URLs not supported. Use HTTPS
url.serviceNotExist: Service does not exist or is inaccessible.
url.invalidUrlWithType: Input a valid URL. Supported services are ${typeList}
url.unknownAGSType: This service type is not supported.

cloud.noResults: No files found. Change your search or select a different item type.

popup.title: Popup blocked
popup.message: Cannot connect to your Cloud Drive account. Be sure you have the pop-up blocker deactivated for this website.

customParameters.description: Add parameters that need to be appended to requests to access this service.
customParameters.append: Append only to requests that draw or query layers
customParameters.helpText: If the web service you're referencing requires additional parameters to be appended to requests sent to the service, you can include them as custom parameters. Parameter names and values are defined on the service and are specific to that service.

appendSelect.chooseUpdate: Choose which type of update you want to perform
appendSelect.insertOnlyEnabled: This feature service only supports adding new features
appendSelect.overwriteDisabledForSharedGroupView: Overwrite is only available for owners and administrators
appendSelect.whyDisabledLink: Learn about conditions that prevent overwriting a hosted feature layer.

add.title: Add features
add.description: Add new features to an existing layer.

update.title: Update features
update.description: Update existing features in a layer.

upsert.title: Add and update features
upsert.description: Add new features to a layer and update existing features at the same time.

overwrite.title: Overwrite entire feature layer
overwrite.description: Overwrite the entire layer with the updated source data.

appendLoadingMessages.appendCloseNotice: Keep your browser window open to monitor the status of the append job. In the case of an incorrect configuration, you can try again without having to re-upload the source file.

appendErrorMessages.appendError: An error happened while appending the item.

cannotAddNullData.title: Unable to add null data
cannotAddNullData.description: Fields do not allow null values

exceededMaxFieldLength.title: Exceeded maximum field length
exceededMaxFieldLength.description: Unable to update the fields. Fields cannot exceed the maximum field length.

invalidFieldType.title: Invalid field type
invalidFieldType.description: Fields cannot be updated with an incompatible data type.

appendUpload.editStyle: Replace the layer's style file with an updated version from your computer.
appendUpload.sameFileNameDescription: The file being uploaded must have the same name and field names as the original file ${fileName}
appendUpload.learnMore: Learn more about supported file types
appendUpload.updatePackages: Replace the ${type} with an updated version from your computer. The uploaded file must have the same name as ${hostedLayerName}.
appendUpload.uploadStaticFiles: The file being uploaded must have the same name as the original file ${fileName}

appendSelectLayer.sameGeometryWarningDescription: Your file contains different types of layer geometries. Try again with layers that have the same geometry type.

File Geodatabase.description: A collection of files in a folder used for storing, querying, and managing both spatial and nonspatial data.

errors.errorWhileUpload: An error occurred while uploading the item.
